# Draft:Warren H. Young

Warren Young should link here
Warren H. Young (1916 â€“ June 6, 1980) was a judge of the District Court of the Virgin Islands from 1971 to 1980.
Appointed by Richard Nixon to a new seat, concurrent with Almeric L. Christian being named chief judge.
Young "presided over the 1973 trial of five young black men charged with murdering eight persons at the Fountain Valley Golf Club".
Young died from lung cancer at his home in Christiansted, Saint Croix, at the age of 63.
